1984-02 â 1984-04 | champions = [[Orillia Travelways]] | no of teams = 8 | commissioner = | prev year = [[1982â83 OJHL season|1982â83]] | next year = [[1984â85 OJHL season|1984â85]] }} The '''1983â84 OJHL [[Season (sports)|season]]''' is the [[List of OJHL seasons|12th]] season of the [[Ontario Provincial Junior A Hockey League (1972-1987)|Ontario Junior Hockey League]] (OJHL). The eight teams of the league played a 42-game season. The all eight teams made the playoffs. The winner of the OJHL playoffs, the [[Orillia Travelways]], won the OHA Buckland Cup and then the [[Dudley Hewitt Cup]] as Central Canadian champions. In 1984, the [[Fred Page Cup|Callaghan Cup]] champion from the east did not compete in the National playdowns, so the Travelways gained a direct berth into the [[1984 Centennial Cup]].
